meanings.definition: The act of measuring the depth of bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The sailors took soundings to check how deep the ocean was.
meanings.sent2: The scientist recorded the soundings of the lake for their research.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman's soundings revealed a hidden treasure chest at the bottom of the sea.
meanings.sent4: Her soundings into the mysterious cave uncovered ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The soundings showed the underwater world to be full of surprises.

meanings.definition: The results or data obtained from measuring the depth of bodies of water.
meanings.sent1: The captain studied the soundings to plan the safest route.
meanings.sent2: The map displayed detailed soundings of the river's depths.
meanings.sent3: The soundings indicated a sudden drop in the ocean floor, surprising the researchers.
meanings.sent4: His analysis of the soundings revealed a pattern in the underwater terrain.
meanings.sent5: The soundings provided valuable information for the marine biologists.

meanings.definition: The act of investigating or exploring a situation or issue.
meanings.sent1: The detective began his soundings into the mysterious disappearance.
meanings.sent2: Her soundings into the company's finances revealed discrepancies.
meanings.sent3: The soundings into the haunted house turned out to be quite an adventure.
meanings.sent4: His soundings into the ancient legend led him to a hidden cave.
meanings.sent5: The soundings into the conspiracy theory uncovered surprising connections.
